reviews.productTitle: Lutron Maestro Fan Control and Light Dimmer for Dimmable LEDs, Incandescent, and Halogen Bulbs, Single-Pole, MACL-LFQ-WH, White
reviews.text: This switch is what I wanted to use for my new fan, but unfortunately I have old wiring that my installer said would not work with this. Bummer I did not want to go into the expense of changing my wiring.

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Maestro Fan Control and Light Dimmer for Dimmable LEDs, Incandescent, and Halogen Bulbs, Single-Pole, MACL-LFQ-WH, White
reviews.text: I am extremely disappointed with the MACL-LFQ light and fan dimmer/control! I have two in my home with Hunter ceiling fans, and both have the same problem. Yes, it is easy to install, but that's as good as it gets. The light works as expected when used without the fan. The fan works occasionally. Typically, using the fan causes the light and fan to ramp up to high and will not shut off! Following the reset procedure does not cause the fan to stop. The fan just starts back spinning. There is simply no way to stop the fan except to pull the chain! Shutting off the breaker has the same result. Tech support/customer service blames the disfunction on using "untested" light bulbs. Unfortunately, "tested" light bulbs are impossible to find! Absolute JUNK!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2025
reviews.title: JUNK!

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Maestro Fan Control and Light Dimmer for Dimmable LEDs, Incandescent, and Halogen Bulbs, Single-Pole, MACL-LFQ-WH, White
reviews.text: I was getting frustrated with other light/fan combo switches because the knobs would break or fall off. No such problem with this design.

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Maestro Fan Control and Light Dimmer for Dimmable LEDs, Incandescent, and Halogen Bulbs, Single-Pole, MACL-LFQ-WH, White
reviews.text: My bad…I didn’t realize that this product does not have wifi abilities. It’s just a normal dimming switch, built for two devices. For the price, it should have included wifi. Ahhh, the Lutron exclusivity tax. That said, the device works fine as a manual dimming switch (it better for what it cost).
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2025
reviews.title: NO WIFI

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Maestro Fan Control and Light Dimmer for Dimmable LEDs, Incandescent, and Halogen Bulbs, Single-Pole, MACL-LFQ-WH, White
reviews.text: I have installed two ceiling fans in my house and use this control for both. It works like it's supposed to. Haven't had any issues or complaints. The first was installed about 4 years ago, and I installed the second last month. It has a little dim LED for each control (light, fan) so it can be seen in the dark, but not so bright it'll bother you.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2025
reviews.title: Works great.

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Maestro Fan Control and Light Dimmer for Dimmable LEDs, Incandescent, and Halogen Bulbs, Single-Pole, MACL-LFQ-WH, White
reviews.text: Lutron has a place in their website that shows approved light bulbs that have been tested and will work with this switch. I've seen reviews where people say the switch didn't work properly after a few weeks or months. I had an issue with flickering green lights on the switch showing an error code. After I bought matching bulbs to install in the ceiling fan that were suggested by Lutron testing, everything has worked perfectly ever since.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2024
reviews.title: Works well, but...get the correct bulbs.

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Maestro Fan Control and Light Dimmer for Dimmable LEDs, Incandescent, and Halogen Bulbs, Single-Pole, MACL-LFQ-WH, White
reviews.text: I bought this to replace my previous switch that used to flicker. These work great. Has a high range of brightness. It was a bit tough screwing the hot wire onto the switch but not a big deal if you're more handy than I am.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2024
reviews.title: Dims Great and Don't Flicker

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Maestro Fan Control and Light Dimmer for Dimmable LEDs, Incandescent, and Halogen Bulbs, Single-Pole, MACL-LFQ-WH, White
reviews.text: I installed 3 of these in my home in late 2022. One starting smoking about 6 months later and shorted out. The second just failed - lights are blinking but nothing works. For the price of these they should last 20 years. I had their old sliding switches for 15 years with no problem - only replaced as they finger slides were plastic and fell off.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2024
reviews.title: Bought 3 in 2022 - two are already broken

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Maestro Fan Control and Light Dimmer for Dimmable LEDs, Incandescent, and Halogen Bulbs, Single-Pole, MACL-LFQ-WH, White
reviews.text: We have this fan switch in our guest room. It is an easy to use fan switch and allows you to power the fan on and off without changing the fan speed, which is a great feature. The light switch is also a dimmer and it will maintain the same level of brightness. In summary the on and off functions are the rocker switches and the fan speed and dimmer controls are to the side of the on off switch. It’s a really great design and works well/easily.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2024
reviews.title: Great fan switch

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Maestro Fan Control and Light Dimmer for Dimmable LEDs, Incandescent, and Halogen Bulbs, Single-Pole, MACL-LFQ-WH, White
reviews.text: I have a Hunter ceiling fan and this switch is perfect. It remembers the settings, so the light or fan isn’t on full blast when you turn it on and off. The dimmer works perfectly with LED bulbs with no buzz. I recommend the Philips Warm Glow because they replicate old incandescent bulbs so well on dimmers. The speed control for the fan is good. No buzzing at any speed. The slow could be a little slower, but that’s a preference Only down side is installation can be tough. It is much deeper than a regular switch, so make sure the box can handle it.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2024
reviews.title: Perfect for my Hunter fan

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Maestro Fan Control and Light Dimmer for Dimmable LEDs, Incandescent, and Halogen Bulbs, Single-Pole, MACL-LFQ-WH, White
reviews.text: I bought three of this switch from a big box store. Whether it works as intended seems heavily dependent on the particular ceiling fan you have, even more so than the finicky dimmable LED bulbs. In one fan/LED configuration, the switch works fine and has a neat feature where you can hold down the button and it stays on for a little bit to give you time to exit the room before the light turns off. However, with the two Hunter fans I have, using bulbs recommended by the Lutron compatibility guide, the switches exhibit unstable, maybe even hazardous behavior. In one fan, the bulbs dim as expected… until you turn the fan on, and then the bulbs turn off and can’t be turned back on until the fan is turned off. Even worse, sometimes this causes the fan switch to become unresponsive and it is impossible to turn the fan off without using the little pull tab cutoff at the bottom of the switch. The other Hunter fan is similarly unstable with the same exact bulbs (swapped) with the fan on, except with that switch the bulbs will not dim at all. So it is a problem with the combination of the Lutron switch and the fan. But the fact that there is “crosstalk” between the lights and fan circuits inside the switch makes me very uncomfortable having this hard-wired inside my wall.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2024
reviews.title: Compatibility and/or quality control issues

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Maestro Fan Control and Light Dimmer for Dimmable LEDs, Incandescent, and Halogen Bulbs, Single-Pole, MACL-LFQ-WH, White
reviews.text: Why can't Lutheran make a fan and light combo switch that works with cassetta with a smart switch Wi-Fi. I just don't understand it. Again. These work fine if you're not trying to get Wi-Fi, built-in or smart, use the smarts hub from lutron. But in general these are just okay. They just look fancy than any analog switch and they're more modern. But for the price point, they really need to drop this thing by 20 30% to be able to compete with some of the generics out there. I don't think a lot of people would be buying these unless you're in the top 1%.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2024
reviews.title: As always a great product but no caseta wireless

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Maestro Fan Control and Light Dimmer for Dimmable LEDs, Incandescent, and Halogen Bulbs, Single-Pole, MACL-LFQ-WH, White
reviews.text: This combo switch is the best switch in my opinion and much easier to install since you do not need to install a reveiver module in the fan housing. They work the best, look the best, install the best, but 4-stars because they are expensive.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2024
reviews.title: These are the best

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Maestro Fan Control and Light Dimmer for Dimmable LEDs, Incandescent, and Halogen Bulbs, Single-Pole, MACL-LFQ-WH, White
reviews.text: This switch will either work for you or it won’t. It’s a gamble. Years ago, I was a certified electrician, so I’m no dummy on the install of this switch. I hooked it up as instructed, using a brand new hunter ceiling fan and when I pressed the fan button and set the speed to the highest setting, it made a terrible whining noise and the blades barely spun. Pressing the light button, there was an awful several second delay and when the light did come on, it flashed and flickered, randomly going out and sometimes on again. I tried 3 different dimmable LED and all produced the same result. Many reviewers complain of the same issue, so I assume it’s a fan compatibility issue. I’m just not going to waste my time making it work. I’m returning it, but maybe others will have better luck.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2024
reviews.title: Compatibility is an issue

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Maestro Fan Control and Light Dimmer for Dimmable LEDs, Incandescent, and Halogen Bulbs, Single-Pole, MACL-LFQ-WH, White
reviews.text: It works great with incandescent lights that you can't find anymore, but I bought and returned 3 different sets of LEDs that were on lutrons list as tested and recommended and none if them worked. All the LEDs I tried worked with the dimmer, as long as you did not turn the fan on. If you run the fan and try to turn on the lights, the light come on for less than a second and turn back off.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2024
reviews.title: Almost impossible to find LEDs that work with this dimmer.

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Maestro Fan Control and Light Dimmer for Dimmable LEDs, Incandescent, and Halogen Bulbs, Single-Pole, MACL-LFQ-WH, White
reviews.text: The first switch I received was totally dead after I wired it in. Returned it and got a replacement which worked perfectly for 3 days, and then out of nowhere it died. Lights dimmed all the way down and neither the fan nor now dimmed lights would turn off. Removed the switch and hardwired the fan and using the pull chains for now and everything is fine. Will look for a different switch to install.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2024
reviews.title: This switch failed me twice

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Maestro Fan Control and Light Dimmer for Dimmable LEDs, Incandescent, and Halogen Bulbs, Single-Pole, MACL-LFQ-WH, White
reviews.text: Installed two of these, one in each of two bedrooms on the same circuit. Two years later in another room a short ocurred on a third device, a recepticle, the only other device on the circuit. After resetting the breaker, I discovered that both switches were destroyed. Tech support informed me that it was a common problem that electricians frequently call about. The switch is more sensitive and reacts faster than a breaker so a short on the circuit will destroy any of these switches installed on it. It was two for two on mine. I'd like to see a more robust design to compensate for known issues like this.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.title: Blown Switches
